PLCCom
Class PLCcomDevice

java.lang.Object
  PLCCom.PLCcomDevice
Direct Known Subclasses:
MPI_Device, PPI_Device, TCP_ISO_Device
public abstract class PLCcomDevice
extends java.lang.Object

abstract base class of device classes

Since:
SDK1.6
Version:
PLCCom (Java) S7 V6
Author:
Indi.Systems GmbH, www.plccom.net, info@indi-systems.de

public abstract int getSlot()

DisConnect

public void DisConnect()
Disconnected the Device

Since:
SDK1.6


Example Code: 



 import PLCCom.*;

 public class main {
   //declare the Device
   private PLCcomDevice Device;

   // Disconnect Device
   private void btnDisConnectActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
       Device.DisConnect();
   }
 }

Connect

public ConnectResult Connect()
Connected the Device

Returns:
Returns the Connect-Result


Example Code: 

import PLCCom.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnConnectActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
      //Connecting Device

        //create TCP_ISO_Device instance from PLCcomDevice
        Device = new TCP_ISO_Device("192.168.1.2", 0, 2, ePLCType.S7_300_400_compatibel);
        //or create MPI_Device instance from PLCcomDevice
        //Device = new MPI_Device("COM2", 0, 2, eBaudrate.b38400, eSpeed.Speed187k, ePLCType.S7_300_400_compatibel);
        //or create PPI_Device instance from PLCcomDevice
        //Device = new PPI_Device("COM2", 0, 2, eBaudrate.b9600, ePLCType.S7_200_compatibel);
        //Enter User here
        authentication.User("");
        //Enter Serial here
        authentication.Serial("");
        Device.setConnecttimeout(1000);
        Device.setReadtimeout(2000);
        ConnectResult res = Device.Connect();
        if (!res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.OK_CANCEL_OPTION);
        }
    }
}
See Also:
ConnectResult

BeginConnect

public void BeginConnect()
Connect the device asynchronous *


Example Code: 

import PLCCom.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass implements iConnectCallback {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnConnectActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
      //Connecting Device

        //create TCP_ISO_Device instance from PLCcomDevice
        Device = new TCP_ISO_Device("192.168.1.2", 0, 2, ePLCType.S7_300_400_compatibel);
        //or create MPI_Device instance from PLCcomDevice
        //Device = new MPI_Device("COM2", 0, 2, eBaudrate.b38400, eSpeed.Speed187k, ePLCType.S7_300_400_compatibel);
        //or create PPI_Device instance from PLCcomDevice
        //Device = new PPI_Device("COM2", 0, 2, eBaudrate.b9600, ePLCType.S7_200_compatibel);
        //Enter User here
        authentication.User("");
        //Enter Serial here
        authentication.Serial("");
        Device.setConnecttimeout(1000);
        Device.setReadtimeout(2000);

        // asynchronous call
        Device.ConnectCBNotifier = new ConnectCallbackNotifier(this);
        Device.BeginConnect();
    }

    public void On_ConnectCallback(ConnectResult Result) {
        if (!Result.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, resources.getString("connect_unsuccessful") + System.getProperty("line.separator") + resources.getString("MessageText") + Result.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}

See Also:
ConnectResult

setAutoConnect

public void setAutoConnect(boolean AutoConnectState)
turn AutoConnect on or off if the flag is set in case of an operation the device will be connected automatically the connection will automatically disconnected after the operation

Parameters:
AutoConnectState - boolean AutoConnect on or off

setAutoConnect

public void setAutoConnect(boolean AutoConnectState,
                           long IdleTimespan)
turn AutoConnect on or off if the flag is set in case of an operation the device will be connected automatically the connection will be maintained until the time span has expired

Parameters:
AutoConnectState - boolean AutoConnect on or off
IdleTimespan - long the time span in milliseconds until the device will be automatically disconnected, 0 or NO_IDLE_TIMESPAN for immediate disconnect

getAutoConnectState

public boolean getAutoConnectState()
Get the actual AutoConnect state

Returns:
boolean Returns AutoConnect on or off

public long getAutoConnectIdleTimespan()
Get the actual idle time span in milliseconds

Returns:
long the actual idle time span in milliseconds

read

public ReadResult[] read(ReadRequest[] Requestdata)
Performs a read

Parameters:
Requestdata - a array of ReadRequest values
Returns:
Array of ReadResult values
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - No request data from parent!


Example Code: 



 import PLCCom.*;

 public class main {

   private void btnreadRawDataActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
   //declare a ReadRequest object
   ReadRequest[] myReadRequest = new ReadRequest[1];
   myReadRequest[0] = new ReadRequest();

   //set the request parameters
   //read 10 Bytes from DB100
   myReadRequest[0].setRegion(eRegion.valueOf(eRegion.DataBlock);
   myReadRequest[0].setDB(100);
   myReadRequest[0].setStartByte(0);
   myReadRequest[0].setLen(10);

   //read from device
   ReadResult[] res = Device.read(myReadRequest);

   //evaluate results
   txtMessage.setText(new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss.ms").format(new Date()) + ": " + res[0].Message());
   txtMessage.setForeground(res[0].Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD) ? Color.black : Color.red);
   txtResult.setText("");
   if (res[0].Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD) && res[0].DataAvailable()) {
      for (byte b : res[0].Buffer()) {
          txtResult.append(String.valueOf(b));
          txtResult.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
      }
      JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res[0].Message(), "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
   }
   else
   {
      JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res[0].Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
   }
 }
}
See Also:
ReadRequest, ReadResult

read

public ReadItemResultCollection read(ReadItemRequestCollection RequestCollection)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
performs a read-operation with several items in a collection

Parameters:
RequestCollection -
Returns:
ReadItemRequestCollection
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - No request data from parent!


Example Code: 


 import PLCCom.*;

 public class main {
 //declare the Device
 private PLCcomDevice Device;

 // read on PLC
    private void btnreadCollectionActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        try {
            //declare a ReadRequest object
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, resources.getString("Message_ReadCollection"), "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);

            ReadItemRequestCollection RequestCollection = new ReadItemRequestCollection();

            // 
            //set request parameter
            ReadItemRequest RequestItem = new ReadItemRequest();
            RequestItem.setRegion(eRegion.DataBlock);
            RequestItem.setDB(1);
            RequestItem.setStartByte(6);
            RequestItem.setQuantity(5);
            RequestItem.setBit((byte) 1);
            RequestItem.setDataType(eDataType.BIT);
            RequestItem.setItemkey("Item1");
            RequestCollection.addReadItemRequest(RequestItem);

            RequestItem = new ReadItemRequest();
            RequestItem.setRegion(eRegion.DataBlock);
            RequestItem.setDB(204);
            RequestItem.setStartByte(4);
            RequestItem.setQuantity(20);
            RequestItem.setDataType(eDataType.BYTE);
            RequestItem.setItemkey("Item2");
            RequestCollection.addReadItemRequest(RequestItem);

            RequestItem = new ReadItemRequest();
            RequestItem.setRegion(eRegion.DataBlock);
            RequestItem.setDB(204);
            RequestItem.setStartByte(240);
            RequestItem.setQuantity(230);
            RequestItem.setBit((byte) 0);
            RequestItem.setDataType(eDataType.BYTE);
            RequestItem.setItemkey("Item3");
            RequestCollection.addReadItemRequest(RequestItem);

            // 
            RequestCollection.setOptmize(true);

            //read from device
            ReadItemResultCollection ResultCollection = Device.read(RequestCollection);

            //evaluate results
            Boolean[] isItemAvalible = new Boolean[1];

            //Option 1 >>> find Itemresult with keyname
            ReadItemResult res1 = ResultCollection.getReadItemResult("Item1", isItemAvalible);
            ReadItemResult res2 = ResultCollection.getReadItemResult("Item2", isItemAvalible);
            ReadItemResult res3 = ResultCollection.getReadItemResult("Item3", isItemAvalible);

            txtMessage.setText(new SimpleDateFormat("dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm:ss.ms").format(new Date()) + ": " + ResultCollection.Message());
            this.txtResult.setText("");

            //Option2 >>> find itemresult with foreach-loop
            for (ReadItemResult res : ResultCollection.getReadItemResult()) {
                txtResult.append("Start Item:");
                txtResult.append(res.Itemkey());
                txtResult.append(" ");
                txtResult.append("Quality:");
                txtResult.append(" ");
                txtResult.append(res.Quality().toString());
                txtResult.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));

                if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
                    Object[] Values = (Object[]) res.getValue();
                    for (Object val : Values) {
                        txtResult.append(val.toString());
                        txtResult.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
                    }
                    txtResult.append("End Item:");
                    txtResult.append(res.Itemkey());
                }
            }
            txtResult.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
            txtResult.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
        } catch (Exception ex) {
        }
    }
 }
See Also:
ReadRequest, ReadResult, ReadItemRequestCollection, ReadItemResultCollection

write

public WriteResult[] write(WriteRequest[] Requestdata)
Performs a write

Parameters:
Requestdata - Requestdata a array of WriteRequest values
Returns:
Array of WriteResult values
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - No request data from parent!


Example Code: 

import PLCCom.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnwriteRawDataActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        //declare a WriteRequest object
        WriteRequest[] myWriteRequest = new WriteRequest[1];
        myWriteRequest[0] = new WriteRequest();

        //set the request parameters
        //write 4 bytes in DB100
        myWriteRequest[0].setRegion(eRegion.DataBlock);
        myWriteRequest[0].setDB(100);
        myWriteRequest[0].setStartByte(0);

        byte[] b = new byte[]{12, 13, 14, 15};

        myWriteRequest[0].setBuffer(b);

        //write
        WriteResult[] res = Device.write(myWriteRequest);

        //evaluate results
        if (res[0].Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res[0].Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}
See Also:
WriteRequest, WriteResult

import PLCCom.*;
import java.util.Calendar;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnGetPLCTimeActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        //execute function
        ReadResult res = Device.GetPLCTime();

        //evaluate results
        if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            Calendar c = res.get_DATE_AND_TIME();
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }

            Calendar c = res.getPLCClockTime();
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);

SetPLCTime

@Deprecated
public WriteResult SetPLCTime(java.util.Calendar newPLCTime)
Deprecated. please use SetPLCClockTime

Set PLC Time Important: Function is deprecated, please use SetPLCClockTime

Parameters:
newPLCTime - a Calendar Object with new PLC-Time
Returns:
WriteResult value
Since:
SDK1.6


Example Code: 

import PLCCom.*;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    // write new time into PLC
    private void btnStartPLCActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
        Calendar data = new GregorianCalendar();
        data.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, data.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY) - 0);
        WriteResult res = Device.SetPLCTime(data);
        //evaluate results
        if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}
See Also:
WriteResult

SetPLCClockTime

public OperationResult SetPLCClockTime(java.util.Calendar newPLCTime)
Set PLC clock time

Parameters:
newPLCTime - Calendar
Returns:
OperationResult


Example Code: 


import PLCCom.*;
import java.util.Calendar;
import java.util.GregorianCalendar;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnSetPLCTimeActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
        Calendar data = new GregorianCalendar();
        //adjust and set hour
        data.set(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY, data.get(Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY) - 0);
        //execute function
        OperationResult res = Device.SetPLCClockTime(data);

        //evaluate results
        if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}

GetLEDInfo

public LEDInfoResult GetLEDInfo()
Return PLC LED Informations / Not for S7-200 PLCs

Returns:
LEDInfoResult value


Example Code: 


import PLCCom.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btngetPLCLEDInfobtngetPLCLEDInfoActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        //execute function
        LEDInfoResult res = Device.GetLEDInfo();

        //evaluate results
        if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            for (LEDInfoResult.sLEDInfo LEDInfo : res.LEDInfo()) {
                sb.append("LED: ");
                sb.append(String.valueOf(LEDInfo.identifier));
                sb.append(" State: ");
                sb.append(String.valueOf(LEDInfo.state));
                sb.append(" flashing ");
                sb.append(String.valueOf(LEDInfo.flashing));
                sb.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
            }
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}

import PLCCom.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btngetPLCBlockListActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        eBlockType BlockType = eBlockType.AllBlocks;
        BlockListResult res = Device.GetBlockList(BlockType);

        //evaluate results
        if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            for (BlockListEntry ble : res.getBlockList()) {
                sb.append(ble.getBlockType().toString());
                sb.append(String.valueOf(ble.getBlockNumber()));
                sb.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
            }
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}

ReadPLCBlock_MC7

public ReadPLCBlockResult ReadPLCBlock_MC7(eBlockType RequestedBlockType,
                                           int BlockNumber)
read the specified block in a byte-array
  • Not for 1200, 1500 and Logo PLCs
  • only available in Expert Edition

Parameters:
RequestedBlockType - a eBlockType member
BlockNumber - number of block
Returns:
ReadPLCBlockResult


Example Code: 


import PLCCom.*;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import javax.swing.JFileChooser;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
import javax.swing.filechooser.FileFilter;
import javax.swing.filechooser.FileNameExtensionFilter;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnBackup_BlockActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        //Backup OB1
        int BlockNumber = 1;
        eBlockType BlockType = eBlockType.OB;

        //open SaveFileDialog
        final JFileChooser dr = new JFileChooser();
        FileFilter filter = new FileNameExtensionFilter("Binary Files *.mc7", "mc7");
        dr.addChoosableFileFilter(filter);
        int returnVal = dr.showSaveDialog(this);
        if (returnVal == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
            //read Block into ReadPLCBlockResult
            ReadPLCBlockResult res = Device.ReadPLCBlock_MC7(BlockType, BlockNumber);

            //evaluate results
            if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
                try {
                    //save buffer in specified file
                    File file = new File(dr.getSelectedFile().getAbsolutePath());

                    //rename file to .mc7, you can adjust the extension
                    if (!file.getAbsolutePath().endsWith(".mc7")) {
                        file = new File(dr.getSelectedFile().getAbsolutePath() + ".mc7");
                    }
                    // if file doesnt exists, then create it
                    if (!file.exists()) {
                        file.createNewFile();
                    }
                    FileOutputStream fs = new FileOutputStream(file);
                    fs.write(res.getBuffer());
                    fs.close();
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Block " + String.valueOf(String.valueOf(BlockType)) + String.valueOf(BlockNumber) + resources.getString("successful_saved") + dr.getSelectedFile().getName(), "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
                } catch (IOException ex) {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "operation unsuccessful", "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
                }
                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
            } else {
                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
            }
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "operation aborted", "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}
See Also:
ReadPLCBlockResult

WritePLCBlock_MC7

public OperationResult WritePLCBlock_MC7(WritePLCBlockRequest Requestdata)
write the byte-array in a specified block
  • Not for 1200, 1500 and Logo PLCs
  • only available in Expert Edition

Parameters:
Requestdata - a WritePLCBlockRequest object
Returns:
OperationResult


Example Code: 


import PLCCom.*;
import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import javax.swing.JFileChooser;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;
import javax.swing.filechooser.FileFilter;
import javax.swing.filechooser.FileNameExtensionFilter;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnRestore_BlockActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {
        final JFileChooser dr = new JFileChooser();
        FileFilter filter = new FileNameExtensionFilter("Binary Files *.mc7, *.bin", "mc7", "bin");
        dr.addChoosableFileFilter(filter);
        int returnVal = dr.showOpenDialog(this);
        if (returnVal == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
            try {
                File file = new File(dr.getSelectedFile().getAbsolutePath());
                if (!file.exists()) {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "operation unsuccessful, file not exist", "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
                    return;
                }
                InputStream is = null;
                byte[] buffer = null;
                try {
                    is = new BufferedInputStream(new FileInputStream(file));
                    buffer = new byte[is.available()];
                    is.read(buffer);
                } finally {
                    is.close();
                }
                WritePLCBlockRequest Requestdata = new WritePLCBlockRequest(buffer);
                //Write Buffer into PLC
                OperationResult res = Device.WritePLCBlock_MC7(Requestdata);

                //evaluate results
                if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "Block " + String.valueOf(Requestdata.getBlockInfo().getHeader().getBlockType()) + String.valueOf(Requestdata.getBlockInfo().getHeader().getBlockNumber()) + "successful saved in PLC! File:" + dr.getSelectedFile().getName(), "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
                } else {
                    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
                }
            } catch (IOException ex) {
                JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "operation unsuccessful", "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
            }
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "operation aborted", "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}
See Also:
OperationResult

GetDiagnosticInfo

public DiagnosticInfoResult GetDiagnosticInfo()
Return PLC diagnostic informations
  • Not for 1200, 1500 and Logo PLCs
  • only available in Expert Edition

Returns:
DiagnosticInfoResult


Example Code: 


import PLCCom.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

    private void btnDiagnoseBufferActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        //read the diagnosticinfo into DiagnosticInfoResult-object
        //execute function
        DiagnosticInfoResult res = Device.GetDiagnosticInfo();

        //evaluate results
        if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            //step through the entries
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            for (DiagnosticInfoEntry myDiagnosticInfoEntry : res.getDiagnosticInfoEntrys()) {
                sb.append("Timestamp: ");
                sb.append(myDiagnosticInfoEntry.getDiagnosticTimestamp().toString());
                sb.append(" ");
                sb.append("ID: ");
                sb.append(String.valueOf(myDiagnosticInfoEntry.getDiagnosticID()));
                sb.append(" ");
                sb.append("Message: ");
                sb.append(myDiagnosticInfoEntry.getDiagnosticText());
                sb.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
            }
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}
See Also:
DiagnosticInfoResult

GetSystemStatusList

public SystemStatusListResult GetSystemStatusList(int SSL_ID,
                                                  int SSL_Index)
Return system status list SSL/SZL from supported PLC
  • Not for 1200, 1500 and Logo PLCs
  • only available in Expert Edition

Parameters:
SSL_ID - the required ssl-id, please search this information in the plc-documentation
SSL_Index - the required ssl-index, please search this information in the plc-documentation
Returns:
SystemStatusListResult


Example Code: 


import PLCCom.*;
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

public class NewClass {

    //declare the Device
    PLCcomDevice Device;

        private void btnReadSSL_SZLActionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt) {

        // important!!! please search the id and index information in the plc-documentation
        // You must convert the specified values hex in decimal
        int SSL_ID = 306; //ID 132 (Hex)
        int SSL_Index = 4; //Index 4 (Hex)
        //execute function
        SystemStatusListResult res = Device.GetSystemStatusList(SSL_ID, SSL_Index);

        //evaluate results
        if (res.Quality().equals(OperationResult.eQuality.GOOD)) {
            StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
            for (SystemStatusListItemEntry ssle : res.getSZLItemEntrys()) {
                for (byte b : ssle.getBuffer()) {
                    sb.append(String.valueOf(b));
                    sb.append(" ");
                }
                sb.append(System.getProperty("line.separator"));
            }
        JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "OK", "", JOptionPane.INFORMATION_MESSAGE);
        } else {
            JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, res.Message(), "", JOptionPane.ERROR_MESSAGE);
        }
    }
}
See Also:
SystemStatusListResult
